com.groupA.location.world

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • FragmentActivity
      • com.groupA.location.world.MainActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocationManagerFragment.LocationManagerListener, LoggingManagerFragment.LoggingManagerListener, MapManagerFragment.MapManagerListener, UIManagerFragment.UIListener

    public class MainActivity
extends FragmentActivity
implements LocationManagerFragment.LocationManagerListener, UIManagerFragment.UIListener, MapManagerFragment.MapManagerListener, LoggingManagerFragment.LoggingManagerListener
    The main activity, called when the app is started. Mostly it just initializes the fragments managing the user interface, the map, the location services and the logging services and passes messages back and forth between them as required. Plenty of message-passing functions between various submodules of the applications here!

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

      • setUpUI

        public void setUpUI()
        Sets up the user interface manager. Nothing much to say here, it looks in the layout file of the main activity for a reference to a fragment named uimanagerfragment (see it on activity_main.xml) and loads the corresponding fragment into uimanager.

      • setUpMapManager

        public void setUpMapManager()
        Sets up the map manager. Nothing much to say here, it looks in the layout file of the main activity for a reference to a fragment named mapmanagerfragment (see it on activity_main.xml) and loads the corresponding fragment into mapmanager.

      • setUpLocationManager

        public void setUpLocationManager()
        Sets up the location manager. This requires a little more care, as the location manager fragment is not associated to a layout file (it does not have any graphical elements). So we have to instantiate it directly, first checking of course if it was not instantiated already (it might happen if the app is restored).

      • setUpCManager

        public void setUpCManager(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Sets up the creature manager, to represent the positions and properties of other players, beacons, and targets
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)
        We are pausing the app, save our data

      • onLogInCommand

        public void onLogInCommand(java.lang.String userID,
                  java.lang.String password)
        The user told the user interface that they want to log in, with userID and password as given. Tell the logging manager this; and then tell the user interface if the login attempt was successful or not.
        Specified by:
        onLogInCommand in interface UIManagerFragment.UIListener
        Parameters:
        userID - The id entered by the user
        password - The password entered by the user (do _not_ store!)

      • onLogPositionCommand

        public void onLogPositionCommand()

      • onLocationUnavailable

        public void onLocationUnavailable()
        The location manager disconnected from Google location services, tell the logging manager to stop requesting the current position.
        Specified by:

      • onNoLocationServices

        public void onNoLocationServices()
        Location services are not available: take care of that
        Specified by:
        onNoLocationServices in interface LocationManagerFragment.LocationManagerListener

      • setUpLoggingManager

        public void setUpLoggingManager()
        Sets up the logging manager. Like in the location manager case, logging fragments are not associated to layout files, so we have to create it directly (first checking if there is not one already).
